Families with children who get Cal-Fresh, Medi-Cal or Foster Care Benefits do not need to apply. Most will get their P-EBT Card in the month of May, starting May 12, 2020.

post_text:
Lucerne Eagle’s Reading Challenge
with Mrs. Kimsey:

Join me on an out-of-this world reading adventure! Get your space travel ears fired up and your drawing/sketch/painting pads ready! Your mission: listen to two chapters a day, create an illustration for each and post a picture to share with other space travel challengers!

Mission Steps:

1. http:/stories.audible.com/listen
2. Click “start listening”
3. Click “Elementary”
4. Click audible story “Zero G” by Dan Wells
5. Listen to two chapters per day
6. Create an illustration for each chapter
7. Post your illustrations with the chapter number in the comments of this post.
8. If you complete mission 1, extend your mission by listening to the sequel “Dragon Planet” by Dan Wells. Include characters, setting, problems, solutions-be creative! Styles can include comic strip, collage art, pencil sketch, pastels, water colors, crayon, ink-pen...enjoy!
text:

post_text:
Greetings Eagles! While we are all sheltering at home and unable to attend school in person, I thought it might be fun to participate in a virtual math challenge together! Here are videos of my own kids (ages 4 and 5) representing the number 5 in very different ways. How many unique ways can you come up with to show 5? For younger students, this could be visually or with a simple number sentence. For older students, it might be a word problem or even a complex multi-step equation! You don’t have to post a video if you don’t want to, a picture is ok. I can’t wait to see what you come up with!

Just remember: every response must be different from the others! Have fun giving me 5!
text:
Greetings Eagles! While we are all sheltering at home and unable to attend school in person, I thought it might be fun to participate in a virtual math challenge together! Here are videos of my own kids (ages 4 and 5) representing the number 5 in very different ways. How many unique ways can you come up with to show 5? For younger students, this could be visually or with a simple number sentence. For older students, it might be a word problem or even a complex multi-step equation! You don’t have to post a video if you don’t want to, a picture is ok. I can’t wait to see what you come up with!

Just remember: every response must be different from the others! Have fun giving me 5!

post_text: Due to the continued threat of the COVID-19 virus, it is with deep regret that the decision was made earlier today for students at Lucerne Elementary School and the rest of Lake County school districts to remain dismissed from school through the end of the school year. If however the situation improves great enough to bring students back in a safe manner, we will do everything possible to get students back in class. Meanwhile stay safe and healthy.

post_text: As many of you are aware, we continue to monitor the Coronavirus epidemic. We are working with state and local health officials, as well as with LCOE staff, to provide updated information about the virus and management of reported cases of COVID-19. We understand there are currently no cases of the virus in Lake County and that children are largely not affected by the virus. Nonetheless, we are doing our part to curb the spread of illness. Currently, our custodians are using a certified cleaner on a daily basis to prevent and kill bacteria and germs. We are using a certified spray and leave process that allows for a longer contact time. Our focus is on high contact areas. We have discussed the process with our custodians and they are very aware of the necessary precautions. The bus driver is also using a disinfectant to clean the bus twice daily. We will work in the coming weeks to deliver student lessons throughout the district that focus on hand washing and hygiene to prevent the spread of all illness. We will continue to share information as it is received.
text: As many of you are aware, we continue to monitor the Coronavirus epidemic. We are working with state and local health officials, as well as with LCOE staff, to provide updated information about the virus and management of reported cases of COVID-19. We understand there are currently no cases of the virus in Lake County and that children are largely not affected by the virus. Nonetheless, we are doing our part to curb the spread of illness. Currently, our custodians are using a certified cleaner on a daily basis to prevent and kill bacteria and germs. We are using a certified spray and leave process that allows for a longer contact time. Our focus is on high contact areas. We have discussed the process with our custodians and they are very aware of the necessary precautions. The bus driver is also using a disinfectant to clean the bus twice daily. We will work in the coming weeks to deliver student lessons throughout the district that focus on hand washing and hygiene to prevent the spread of all illness. We will continue to share information as it is received.

post_text: Weather conditions, including potential fire risk, have been forecast that may impact electric service to portions of our service area. If the electricity goes out while students are in session, we will finish the school day. If the power goes out while your students are not at school, school will be closed until the power is restored. Alerts will be sent over the school text line and on our Facebook page.

post_text:
CHARACTER COUNTS greatly assists schools by instilling academic, social, emotional and values, mindsets and character traits that will guide students to:
Reach their academic potential and have the ability to succeed in school
Succeed in the workplace and their careers
Live happy, worthy and fulfilling personal lives
Become engaged, responsible and productive citizens

The next CHARACTER COUNTS assembly will be held on Monday, September 30th at 10:00a.m. The Character trait being recognized is CITIZENSHIP!

For more information about Character Counts visit their website at charactercounts.org

post_text:
Absenteeism in the first month of school can predict poor attendance throughout the school year. Half the students who miss 2-4 days in September go on to miss nearly a month of school.

Be Here Everyday On Time! Attendance Challenge Week is September 23 - September 27. Let's have 100% perfect attendance!

post_text:
The 3rd Annual Lake County Attednance Challenge is sponsored by HABEMATOLEL POMO OF UPPER LAKE and administered by the Lake County Office of Education.

The challenge will take place during the weeks of September 23-27, 2019 and March 2-6, 2020!

The Lake County Attendance Challenge is a friendly competition between all public school districts throughout Lake County to promote the importance of school attendance. The challenge is part of the Lake County Office of Education "Count Us In! Attendance Matters awareness campaign and a stepping stone to promote the conversation about the importance of attending school each and every day.

Back-to-School night will be held Wednesday, September 4, 2019 from 6:00 to 7:00 p.m. A parent meeting will be held in your student’s classroom at 6:00 p.m. to discuss Title I, parent involvement and notification of parent rights. Your attendance provides an excellent opportunity to meet teachers, see the classroom environment, and become familiar with our school, curriculum, and school rules. We look forward to seeing you. This will be a minimum day for all students.
The minimum day schedule is as follows:
Kindergarten -12:30 p.m.
Transitional Kindergarten -1:30 p.m.
Primary Grades 1-3 -1:00 p.m.
Upper Grades 4-8 -1:30 p.m.

The first day of school is Wednesday, August 14th. Morning supervision and breakfast begins at 8:00 a.m. and classes start at 8:25 a.m. Classroom assignments will be posted outside the office on Tuesday, August 13th at 4:30 p.m. You can also view your students class assignment by logging into your portal account.

Reminder: Online Student Registration is NOW available for the 2019/2020 school year. You will need to first set-up an account in the SchoolWise parent portal. Portal accounts may be activated using a computer or cell phone at lucerne.schoolwise.com If you need assistance setting up an account or need your portal code, please call or stop by the school office.

shared_text:
Lucerne Elementary School
June 25, 2019 at 1:58 PM ·

Online Student Registration is NOW available for the 2019/2020 school year. Parents can read and complete the first day registration packets online and update student medical information, addresses, telephone numbers, and emergency contacts. You will need to first set-up an account in the SchoolWise parent portal. Schoolwise portal codes were mailed home. Portal accounts may be activated using a computer or cell phone at lucerne.schoolwise.com
If you need assistance setting up an account or need your portal code, please call or stop by the school office. Once you have created your parent portal setup, you may begin the Online Registration process using the registration walk-through screenshots.

post_text: California is moving its California Assessment of Student Performance and Progress (CAASPP) and the English Language Proficiency Assessments for California (ELPAC) Student Score Reports to an electronic format that will be delivered online. The 2019 CAASPP test results are available online NOW! Parents will need to create a SchoolWise parent portal account to access their students test scores. If you need assistance setting up an account, please call or stop by the school office.

post_text:
AVID PARENT NIGHT: ESCAPE ROOMS
Do you like a good mystery? Do you like puzzles? Then make sure to join us on March 27th from 6:00-7:30 for our AVID Parent Night. We are hosting an "Escape Room" themed event for the whole family. Where you will work in collaborative teams to solve a mystery within 30 minutes in order to escape the classroom. We will have a range of activities to engage all students K-8th and their parents.

post_text:
MOTHER & SON DANCE
The Lucerne Elementary Mother/Son Dance will be held Friday, March 8th from 6:00pm to 8:00 pm. Mothers, Grandmothers, Aunts, or any special mother figure get ready to enjoy a fun filled evening with your special young man. The evening will be a western theme and will be serving a baked potato bar with all the yummy fixings, plus dessert. Pre-sale tickets will be $15/couple + $5 each additional boy and will available to purchase March 4th-8th.

post_text:
On January 27th a Green Jello Punk Rock puppet making class and sensory friendly acoustic music jam was held at the Lake County Fair grounds. The event was sponsored by the Lake County Theater Company and produced by Melissa and Tom Simons. The event had an adult evening concert and a kids puppet show concert. During the puppet show kids created their own masks out of foam and duck tape! Proceeds from the event went to SNAPS Lake County (Special Needs Advocacy and Parent Support) and Lucerne Elementary School's Special Education Program. A very BIG thank you goes to LCTC and Tom and Melissa Simons for their generosity and support!

Pictured - Mike Brown, Principal/Superintendent of Lucerne Elementary is presented a check and a custom foam head from Tom Simons in the amount of $3101.00!

post_text: Author Alane Adams visited our school January 31st and read her book "The Circus Thief" to our K-3rd grade classes. She talked to our 4th through 8th grade students about the elements needed for writing a good story. Students were given a copy of one of Alane's books after the presentation. Thank you Alane Adams and the Rise Up Foundation for making an impact in the lives of our Lucerne Students!

post_text: Lucerne Elementary School will be open today, Wednesday November 14th. The safety of our students and staff is taken very seriously. Indoor recesses will be held if air quality is a concern. The classrooms are safe and hvac systems will be running to purify the indoor air. We appreciate your support and understand if you choose to keep your student at home if there are health concerns such as students with asthma. We have some fun events planned this week for our students and free breakfast and lunches are always served as well! We look forward to seeing all of you this morning.

100% ATTENDANCE CHALLENGE
All Lake County schools will be competing with each other for bragging rights to who has the best attendance. The attendance challenge week will begin October 15-19, 2018.
We have fun things planned all week, so don't miss it!
Listen to music at lunch every day
Earn 3 soar points for daily attendance
Raffle drawings at lunch grades K-3
Passes everyday for attendance grade 4-8
A popcorn/movie party for the class with the best attendance

HERE EVERYDAY ON TIME
